Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Cards

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
Model.Cards.Deck
public class Deck extends Object
Represents a standard deck of 52 playing cards. This class manages a complete deck containing all combinations of 13 symbols and 4 suits. The deck is implemented as a Deque (double-ended queue) to efficiently support drawing cards from the top and adding cards back. The deck supports various operations including: Drawing cards from the top Adding cards back to the deck Shuffling the deck randomly Creating new decks from existing card collections Upon creation, the deck is automatically initialized with all 52 cards and shuffled randomly to ensure fair play.
Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • Deck

      public Deck()
      Constructs a new Deck containing all 52 standard playing cards. The deck is automatically initialized with one card for each combination of symbol and suit, then shuffled randomly to ensure unpredictability.

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a card to the top of the deck. The card becomes the next card to be drawn when getCard() is called.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to add to the top of the deck

    • getCard

      public Card getCard()
      Removes and returns the top card from the deck. This operation reduces the deck size by one.
      Returns:
      the card from the top of the deck
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the deck is empty and no card can be drawn

    • makeNewDeck

      public void makeNewDeck(List<Card> cards)
      Creates a new deck from a list of cards and adds them to the current deck. The provided cards are shuffled randomly before being added to ensure randomness. This method is particularly useful for recycling discarded cards back into play when the main deck runs low or empty. The cards are added to the top of the existing deck in shuffled order.
      Parameters:
      cards - the list of cards to shuffle and add to the deck

    • getDeck

      public Deque<Card> getDeck()
      Returns the underlying Deque containing all cards currently in the deck. This provides direct access to the deck's internal structure and allows for iteration or size checking. Note: Modifying the returned Deque directly will affect the internal state of the deck.
      Returns:
      the deck as a Deque of Card objects

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      Shuffles all cards currently in the deck randomly. The deck is temporarily converted to a list, shuffled using Collections.shuffle(List), cleared, and then restored with the shuffled cards. This ensures a secure random distribution of cards throughout the deck.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method for testing the Deck class functionality. Creates a new deck, draws one card from the top, prints its symbol, and then prints the symbols of all remaining cards in the deck to demonstrate proper initialization and card drawing.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments (not used)
